System - Programmer

  1. Introduction

    Windows executable file ends with .exe, a MCU executable (binary) file ends with .hex. A programmer is a hardware device that download this file from a PC to the target MCU. The programmer connects both PC and the MCU. The MCU's side interface is call In-System Programming interface. Every AVR has a set of pins for downloading the .hex file and write it into flash memory.

    This interface is usually a SPI interface, and the target MCU behaves as a slave device. The /RESET is used as the chip select pin. When /RESET is high input, the MCU executes its program. When /RESET is low input, the MCU listens for programming.

  2. AVR SPI Protocol

    The AVR programmer actually sends program (.hex file) according to the AVR SPI Protocol. AVR SPI Protocol defines commands and timing signal for modified the data on the flash and eeprom memory.

    The Arduino SPI program is also wrote according to this protocol.
